intro: Tricalysia benguellensis, commonly known as the Benguella trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
